description: Non-Patent Literature publication identification. Source: PATSTAT and DOCDB.
name: npl_publn_id

fields.description: Origin of the citation (e.g. APPlicant, SEArch report, etc)
fields.name: origin

fields.description: DOCDB publication number of citing patent(s)
fields.name: publication_number

description: Digital Object Identifier. DOIs are in wide use mainly to identify academic, professional, and government information, such as journal articles, research reports and data sets, and official publications.
name: DOI

description: International Standard Serial Number. It is an 8-digit code used to identify newspapers, journals, magazines and periodicals of all kinds and on all media â€“- print and electronic.
name: ISSN

description: Electronic International Standard Serial Number. When a serial with the same content is published in more than one media type, a different ISSN is assigned to each media type. The ISSN system refers to the electronic ISSN  as the ISSNe.
name: ISSNe

description: PubMed Central Identifier. The PMCID is a unique reference number or identifier that is assigned to every article that is accepted into PubMed Central -- an archive of full-text journal articles.
name: PMCID

description: PubMed Identifier. The PMID is a unique reference number for PubMed citations.
name: PMID

description: Document-specific identifier, if not in DOI, ISSN, ISSNe, PMCID, PMID.
name: idno

description: Title of the item holding the NPL -- for non journal items only , e.g. conference, proceedings, etc.
name: title_m

description: Issue number of the item holding the NPL (e.g. journal, proceedings, etc)
name: issue

description: Volume number of the item holding the NPL (e.g. journal, proceedings, etc)
name: volume

description: Issues detected in row. See: https://github.com/cverluise/SciCit/issues/<issue number>.
name: Issues
